thread.title: Nitish Bharadwaj: Gurgaon has developed so much, I struggle to locate my cousin’s residence
thread.title_full: Nitish Bharadwaj: Gurgaon has developed so much, I struggle to locate my cousin’s residence - The Times of India

author: Pratyush Patra
title: Nitish Bharadwaj: Gurgaon has developed so much, I struggle to locate my cousin’s residence
text:
Actor Nitish Bharadwaj had first visited Gurgaon way back in 1996, and when he comes back to the city now, he can barely reco gnise it.
"I first visited Gurgaon in 1996, when my cousin bought a flat here. The city was mostly barren at that point of time. It has developed so much, that when I visit Gurgaon now, I struggle to locate my cousin's residence," said the actor, who was in the city recently for a play.
READ: I shop for jootis in Chandni Chowk: Nitish Bharadwaj
For him, Gurgaon is just an extension of Delhi and he can enjoy his favourite Punjabi delicacies at both places. However, when it comes to the theatre audience, Nitish has noted a difference between Gurgaon and Delhi. "The audience in both the places have a fondness for theatre. In Delhi, however, people are more expressive, while in Gurgaon, people have a more nuanced manner of appreciating the art. Also, Delhi has more free shows to offer, while Gurgaon doesn't," he added.
